text.p: Tele-Communications Inc said on Thursday it has begun offering commercially @HOME, a high-speech service that allows customers access to the Internet.
The service, which is being offered in Fremont, California, will be available for an installation fee of $150 and a monthly fee of $34.95, said Bruce Ravenel, president of TCI Internet Services Inc.
On a teleconfernece call, Ravenel said the company did not expect to be disclosing any customer figures until early next year.
The service will be introduced in nearby Sunnyvale, California and then in Hartford, Connecticut and later in Arlington Heights, Illinois in the fall, he said.
"We will be moving on to many additional markets next year," he said.
Customers will connect to the Internet via a cable channel, whose greater capacity than a telephone line will allow faster service, TCI has said.
